text:
Kurt Julius Isselbacher (September 12, 1925 – July 18, 2019) was a German-born American physician and gastroenterologist. He was the Mallinckrodt Distinguished Professor of Medicine at Harvard Medical School and Director Emeritus of the Massachusetts General Hospital Cancer Center. He was born in Wirges, Germany.
He was elected to the National Academy of Sciences in 1973.
Isselbacher died on July 18, 2019 in Boston, Massachusetts from a stroke at the age of 93.
